fact: Bananas are berries, but strawberries aren't.
Honey never spoils and can last thousands of years.
Octopuses have three hearts and blue blood.
Humans share about 60% of their DNA with bananas.
A day on Venus is longer than a year on Venus.
Sharks have been around longer than trees.
Wombat poop is cube-shaped.
The Eiffel Tower can grow more than 6 inches in the summer.
A group of flamingos is called a 'flamboyance'.
There are more stars in the universe than grains of sand on Earth.
Cats can't taste sweet things.
Koalas sleep for up to 22 hours a day.
Jellyfish have been around for more than 500 million years.
The unicorn is the national animal of Scotland.
Penguins propose to their mates with a pebble.
Humans and giraffes have the same number of neck vertebrae.
A snail can sleep for up to three years.
Butterflies taste with their feet.
Tigers have striped skin, not just striped fur.
Slugs have four noses.
The inventor of the Frisbee was turned into a Frisbee after he died.
There are more trees on Earth than stars in the Milky Way.
A cloud can weigh more than a million pounds.
Sea otters hold hands while sleeping to keep from drifting apart.
Bees can recognize human faces.
A shrimp's heart is in its head.
The world's smallest reptile was discovered in 2021, a chameleon just over half an inch long.
There are more fake flamingos in the world than real ones.
A group of crows is called a 'murder'.
Only 12 people have ever walked on the moon.
Cows have best friends and get stressed when separated.
A newborn kangaroo is small enough to fit in a teaspoon.
A bolt of lightning contains enough energy to toast 100,000 slices of bread.
Dolphins have names for each other.
Polar bear fur is actually transparent, not white.
Some turtles can breathe through their butts.
Starfish have no brains.
A group of porcupines is called a 'prickle'.
The average person walks the equivalent of three times around the world in their lifetime.
The moon is moving away from Earth at a rate of about 1.5 inches per year.
A blue whale's heart is as big as a small car.
There are more public libraries in the U.S. than McDonald's restaurants.
You can't hum while holding your nose closed.
The world's largest snowflake was 15 inches wide.
An ostrich's eye is bigger than its brain.
The world's deepest postbox is in Japan, 10 meters underwater.
Elephants are the only mammals that can't jump.
The longest hiccuping spree lasted 68 years.
Bats always turn left when leaving a cave.
Mosquitoes are attracted to people who have recently eaten bananas.
A sneeze can travel up to 100 miles per hour.
A group of owls is called a 'parliament'.
It's impossible to fold a paper more than seven times.
A hummingbird weighs less than a penny.
Sloths take two weeks to digest their food.
An eagle's eyesight is about five times sharper than a human's.
A chameleon's tongue is twice the length of its body.
Hot water freezes faster than cold water, a phenomenon known as the Mpemba effect.
An adult human has 206 bones, but a baby is born with about 300.
A cat has 32 muscles in each ear.
Some fish can recognize themselves in a mirror.
The heart of a shrimp is located in its head.
A day on Mercury lasts about 59 Earth days.
Peanuts are not nuts; they are legumes.
Ants never sleep.
Dolphins sleep with one eye open.
Cows can go upstairs, but not downstairs.
An octopus has nine brains.
A crocodile can't stick out its tongue.
The Mantis Shrimp can punch with the speed of a bullet.
Bees can fly higher than Mount Everest.
The shortest war in history was between Britain and Zanzibar and lasted only 38 minutes.
A group of jellyfish is called a 'smack'.
An apple floats because it is 25% air.
There are more chickens on Earth than people.
An octopus can regrow lost arms.
Bubble wrap was originally invented as wallpaper.
Spiders can have up to 12 eyes.
The world's smallest mammal is the bumblebee bat.
A cockroach can live for weeks without its head.
A giraffe's tongue is blue-black and can be over 20 inches long.
The fingerprints of a koala are almost indistinguishable from a human's.
The fastest land animal is not the cheetah but the peregrine falcon, which can dive at speeds over 240 mph.
The blue whale is the loudest animal on Earth.
All polar bears are left-handed.
A rhinoceros' horn is made of hair.
The tallest man ever recorded was 8 feet 11 inches tall.
A group of lemurs is called a 'conspiracy'.
The electric eel can produce a shock of up to 600 volts.
The Hawaiian alphabet only has 12 letters.
Frogs can freeze without dying.
The world's largest grand piano weighs over a ton.
A group of frogs is called an 'army'.
An ant can lift 50 times its own body weight.
Giraffes have no vocal cords.
A hummingbird's heart beats more than 1,200 times per minute.
Humans are the only animals that blush.
The longest recorded flight of a chicken is 13 seconds.
The platypus doesn't have a stomach.
There's a species of jellyfish that is biologically immortal.
